lines.gurmukhi: jYsy As√çnI suqh Cwif AMDkwir mD jwiq pun Awvq hY sunq snyh kY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Asvanee Soutah Chhaadi Andhakaari Madha , Jaati Poun Aavat Hai Sounat Sanayh Kai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a mare leaves the house with her master to help him do his work leaving her colt back home and returns home remembering its young one.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy inMdRwvMq supnMqr idsMqr mY bolq GtMqr cYqMn giq gyh kY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Nindraavant Soupanantar Disantar Mai , Bolat Ghatantar Chaitann Gati Gayh Kai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a sleeping person visits many cities and countries in his dream, mumbles in his throat, but once out of his sleep performs his household duties attentively.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy qau pryvw qiRXw qRXwg huie AkwscwrI dyiK prkr igrY qn bUMd myh kY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Tau Parayvaa Triyaa Tyaag Hui Akaasachaaree , Daykhi Parakar Girai Tan Boond Mayh Kai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a he-pigeon leaves his mate and flies in the sky but seeing his mate, he comes down towards her at such a fast pace as a drop of rain falls from the sky,

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy mn bc kRm Bgq jgq ibKY dyK kY snyhI hoq ibsn ibdyh kY ]616]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Man Bach Kram Bhagat Jagat Bikhai , Daykh Kai Sanayhee Hot Bisan Bidayh Kai ?616?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly a devotee of the Lord lives in this world and his family but when he sees his beloved Satsangis, he becomes ecstatic of mind, words and deeds. (He becomes absorbed in the loving state that the Lord blesses him with through Naam).
